item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (96 points | 50 comments)
2. Adding iodine to salt played a role in cognitive improvements: research (2013) (54 points | 9 comments)
3. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (37 points | 9 comments)
4. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (46 points | 6 comments)
5. I still like Sublime Text (812 points | 437 comments)
6. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (332 points | 131 comments)
7. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (103 points | 692 comments)
8. A minimal PyTorch implementation for training your own small LLM from scratch (13 points | 1 comment)
9. DeepSeek's Hidden Bias: How We Cut It by 76% Without Performance Loss (40 points | 16 comments)
10. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
11. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (42 points | 1 comment)
12. Intel doesn't know how to be a foundry," Tim Cook reportedly told TSMC's CEO (61 points | 34 comments)
13. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (84 points | 18 comments)
14. Google Pixel 4a's old firmware is gone, trapping users on buggy battery update (150 points | 113 comments)
15. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (233 points | 144 comments)
16. Why DeepSeek had to be open source (448 points | 202 comments)
17. Astral – "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (60 points | 9 comments)
18. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (58 points | 21 comments)
19. Effective AI code suggestions: less is more (11 points | 4 comments)
20. White House rescinds federal aid freeze (12 points | 3 comments)
21. No Man's Sky's update introduces billions of new stars, planets, and more (37 points | 10 comments)
22. The ancient discovery that put a Silk Road city back on the map (30 points | 8 comments)
23. Nvidia Shares Resume Fall (33 points | 15 comments)
24. Complete hardware and software setup for running Deepseek-R1 locally (176 points | 132 comments)
25. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (667 points | 481 comments)
26. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (57 points | 18 comments)
27. Cali's AG Tells AI Companies Almost Everything They're Doing Might Be Illegal (145 points | 115 comments)
28. Only 1 in 10 Oracle Java users want to stay with Big Red (49 points | 28 comments)
29. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (1012 points | 329 comments)
30. Composable SQL (245 points | 116 comments)
